banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: Finally, tech solutions to economic development
videoData.socialTitle: Finally, tech solutions to economic development

nodes.whoTheyAre: Sarah Cairns-Smith is a Senior Advisor at BCG, based in Boston. She has worked across a broad variety of sectors in global development and health including water, sanitation and hygiene; financial services and education; mobile and big data; agriculture; and health product research, development and delivery. She received her PhD in Biochemistry from the Imperial Cancer Research Fund, London and MBA (Distinction) from Columbia Business School.

videoData.description: In Kenya, a smartphone app called iCow tracks the health of cattle for thousands of farmers, at times doubling productivity. In this talk, Sarah Cairns-Smith discusses how a range of mobile apps are transforming local economies in Sub-Saharan Africa.
videoData.socialDescription: In Kenya, a smartphone app called iCow tracks the health of cattle for thousands of farmers, at times doubling productivity. In this talk, Sarah Cairns-Smith discusses how a range of mobile apps are transforming local economies in Sub-Saharan Africa.
